messages.title: A Strong Voice for Riverside
messages.content: As a social worker, community activist, and lifelong local resident, I've seen our communities devastated by nearly a decade of austerity. Too many of our children have been raised in poverty, health and foodbanks, and homelessness rise every day. Liverpool, and our country, desperately needs real change.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Will ensure that more of the wealth stays in the community. Support relocation of the Treasury to Liverpool, jobs, and £150 billion of investment. Local contracts to go to local firms and support “shares for workers” schemes.
Will fight against discriminatory hiring practices and the racial pay gap. Promote diversity and inclusion across all sectors.
Will fight for free personal care for those over 65 and move towards a National Care Service, ensuring every vulnerable person receives the support they deserve.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Labour has pledged a referendum in the next 6 months, with Remain on the ballot paper.

issues.brexitEurope: Labour has pledged a referendum in the next 6 months, with Remain on the ballot paper.
issues.economy: Support relocation of the Treasury to Liverpool, bringing with it jobs and £150 billion worth of investment.
issues.health: Working in adult social care, I see first-hand how Tory austerity cuts have devastated services.
issues.labourEmployment: Will fight against discriminatory hiring practices and the racial pay gap.
issues.socialWelfare: We will build a welfare state that guarantees dignity for those struggling to get by.

leaflet.personalStatement: As a social worker, community activist, and lifelong local resident, I've seen our communities devastated by nearly a decade of austerity. Too many of our children have been raised in poverty, health and foodbanks, and homelessness rise every day. Liverpool, and our country, desperately needs real change.

endorsements.endorsement: I've seen Kim in action at Squash Nutrition, a social enterprise in L8. Kim truly cares about our community and is especially inspirational as she would be Liverpool's first Black MP.

I have known Kim for nearly 30 years and in that time she has demonstrated integrity, loyalty, professionalism and empathy in her work. This has made Kim a memorable figure as Liverpool’s first Black MP.

examples: Labour has pledged a referendum in the next 6 months, with Remain on the ballot paper.
As a social worker, community activist, and lifelong local resident, I've seen our communities devastated by nearly a decade of austerity.
Support relocation of the Treasury to Liverpool, bringing with it jobs and £150 billion worth of investment.
Labour has pledged a referendum in the next 6 months, with Remain on the ballot paper.
We will build a welfare state that guarantees dignity for those struggling to get by.
I've seen Kim in action at Squash Nutrition, a social enterprise in L8. Kim truly cares about our community and is especially inspirational as she would be Liverpool's first Black MP.

I have known Kim for nearly 30 years and in that time she has demonstrated integrity, loyalty, professionalism and empathy in her work. This has made Kim a memorable figure as Liverpool’s first Black MP.
As a social worker, community activist, and lifelong local resident, I've seen our communities devastated by nearly a decade of austerity.
Too many of our children have been raised in poverty, health and foodbanks, and homelessness rise every day.
The Tories & Lib Dems will deny the people of Riverside a final say on Brexit.
